intro: Hieracium pyrsjuense, commonly known as the Pyrenean hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowering period occurs from late spring to early summer, producing yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium pyrsjuense is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in well-drained, nutrient-poor soils.
